content: a one-skein entrelac turban inspired by little edie beale of grey gardens with a twist the first time we watched grey gardens we stayed right on that sofa and watched it clear through a second time those accents those outfits those aristocratic manners amidst all that chaos and decay say what you will about little edie no one can deny that she had a make-do attitude and an instinctive style of her own in our book being a staunch character is the highest of compliments while we may not be inclined to wear our skirts upside down and safety-pinned shut edie s love of a good turban made an impression on us we wanted to design one that would be an homage to little edie without being too literal read without the baubles and broaches entrelac is our absolute favorite stitch pattern - it s like little diamonds of knitted wonder - and in a hand-dyed and handspun singles yarn entrelac is unpredictable and stunning like our muse of course materials spincycle yarns 100% bluefaced leicester wool 120 yd per 80 gram skein shown in idle nights 1 skein or the perfect crime 1 skein in entrelac you ll be completing each block before moving on to the next rather than working across all sts at once as you normally do when knitting if this is your first entrelac project now is a good time to take a deep breath and stop trying to understand the pattern by reading it all first relax and just follow the directions step-by-step on resizing to make your turban a little longer work one extra set of right- and left-slanting tiers before dividing for the twist by working an extra set your seam will be slightly off-center -- but as long as you seam neatly it won t matter
